data.what_is:
Textedly makes SMS Marketing easy! Instantly send 10 or 100,000 mass SMS text messages to any mobile phone number. Easily build an opt-in subscriber list. Instantly upload your list of mobile phone number subscribers. Schedule text messages to go out any time you want. Track text message delivery. Set up SMS messaging Drip Campaigns!

Utilize Textedly's Text-to-Pay feature. Your Textedly account comes with your own credit card merchant account so that you can start taking credit card payments. Text invoices or charge a card over the phone. 

Use Textedly's Business Text Reviews. Collect, manage, and monitor online reviews with Textedly's online review management tools. We make it easy to showcase positive feedback across the internet. 

Whether you're sending mobile text messages for marketing alerts, sales events, coupons, discounts, announcements, or notifications... Textedly makes communicating with your contacts easy and efficient. Import contacts and manage lists all through your Textedly account.

Use our Zapier integration to integrate Textedly with over 2,000+ apps that you love and already use.

Send mass MMS picture messages, videos, and even PDF files.
data.product_description:
Textedly is an SMS marketing communications channel that allows you to advertise, promote, announce, and engage with your audience through text messaging directly to cell phones.

Textedly makes communicating with your contacts easy and efficient through their SMS and MMS Mass Texting Messaging service.Textedly is "The World's Best Text Messaging  Company" for many reasons. To begin with, Textedly is the most cost effective platform in the industry. No other mass texting platform comes close our our pricing plans.Textedly is also better than all the competitors in the mass texting space because we have the most and best features to use. Auto-replies, Drip Campaigns, Personalization, Instagram Texting. Text-to-Pay is an amazing feature that give you your own credit card merchant account. And Text Review help you build your online reputation across a number of review sites, include Google Business Review. You name it, Textedly has everything you will need to be successful.Textedly is also the best, because we offer you the ability to send mass MMS picture messages, videos, and even PDF files. Textedly does everything!

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 23 Textedly reviews. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 25 Textedly reviews. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: As reported in 28 Textedly reviews. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 25 Textedly reviews. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 28 Textedly reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: As reported in 24 Textedly reviews. Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.  This feature was mentioned in 26 Textedly reviews.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.  This feature was mentioned in 24 Textedly reviews.

initial_reviews.review_title: Very quick responses to my beginner questions...
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I would happily reccomend Textedly for mass texting solutions. I switched to textedly from another texting app largely due to a lack of customer service and I have been very pleased with Textedly's quick and thorough responses to my questions. I received a call from a Danni M. within just a few minutes of signing up for the service and she assisted me in getting my account setup. That was super helpful. Also a live chat person named Paige has been very helpful, in both answering my questions and getting support tickets created for a few minor problems I had (due to my own errors). I have only been a customer for little more than a week but so far I have nothing bad to say about this service.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
No complaints so far. It is a little bit more expensive than my last texting service but overall I think the cost is not too bad. Ease of use and helpful/ prompt customer service has made it very worthwhile.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I run a fundraiser for a non-profit that needs an easy way to stay in touch with my customer base, textedly allows me to easily organize my text mailer list and communicate efficiently with those customers.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
We have been using Textedly for over two years and are totally satisfied!  We have a Community Notifications Program.  We send messages to about 200 recipients.  We have had ZERO complaints and a multitude of positive reinforcements!
ALSO...We have been a Textedly customer for about 2 1/2 years and we am very pleased with Textedly. We noticed this morning that when a message is sent OR stored, the messages are in chronological order! This change has just happened in the last two weeks (June 2024)! This makes it so much easier to check when the messages go out via time and date! THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU, FOR YOUR UPDATE TO TEXTEDLY!

What do you dislike about Textedly?
There is no answer for this question...THEY'RE GREAT!!!!!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem Textedly has solved is communicating important messages concerning our members with Emergency and non-emergency information.

initial_reviews.review_title: If youre anythng like me, selecting the right service for wht you need is a time consuming challenge
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I have a high degree of appreciation for the support team, live chat features, and personal phone calls i had with representatives. All of whom thoroughly assisted me in process of getting this service set up.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Its not textedlys fault, but these federal regulations on communications, such as this service, are overreaching and unwelcomed. As a small business owner who is intending to use this service to keep in touch with our (personal partners) 200-400 1099 contractors, these regulations are costly, confusing, and hold me accoutnable to the same standards you might see from a 50,000 person marketing campaign. Textedly support team has done a phenominal job walking us through this setup process.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am only one person and due to the nature of my business and industry, i have to keep up with 500 different people on a semi-monthly basis. This service will help me keep in touch with the individuals that fall through the cracks when trying to keep up with that many people manually.

initial_reviews.review_title: Could be better, could be worse.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The tech-support is top notch, and they are always quick to respond. Also, I love that you can design text messages that include images.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
My organization holds multiple events throughout the year, and I would like to be able to update phone numbers in bulk batches with new tags, so I can send messages to the appropriate groups. However, Textedly does not let you do that and Unless you are going to go one by one on each account, you must upload the individual again with a new tag. So, I have some numbers in there 4 or 5 times because they are a part of 4 or 5 groups.

A bulk update feature like Mailchimp has would be very helpful.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us notify our the clients we serve of upcoming events, cancellations, and other important information. It is quick and allows us to notify large groups of people at once.

initial_reviews.review_title: Texting is better for churches than email
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I love texting for churches. Ease of use, high response rates, and ability to drive behaviors is all excellent for texting vs other avenues of communication.

But why textedly?

Easy to get started & implement -
Customer support - a few minutes ago, I messaged customer support, and had a response in just a few minutes.
Speed and frequency of use - I can communicate with our entire congregation in seconds.
Excellent integrations - with various CRM options. They've been very growth oriented for the last several years that we've been with them.

Textedly has helped us grow our engagement with our congregation by promoting events, creating discipleship opportunities, and more.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Honestly, there's not much that I don't like.

Some of the features that are 1-time fees I wish were native, but that's about it.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I want to be able to quickly communicate in a venue that people receive and actually READ... then drive key behaviors and interactions. Textedly helps me do that.

What do you dislike about Textedly?

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Interface is user friendly. I can create messages quickly and send them conveniently. I can always depend on my messages being received when I want them to be received.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I use textedly as a way to send notifications and reminders to employees. When employees are terminated, I unsubscribe them. When we re-hire them, I have to make them go through the re-subscribe process. This is very time consuming and some of the re-hires don't understand how it works. Many employees slip through the cracks because of this system. Unsubscribed contacts cannot be deleted, which clutters up my contacts list. We have employees coming and going constantly.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Employees don't read emails often, but they do respond to texts. We can send out company reminders and notifications and know that they will see them because they come through a text. We are getting better participation with different programs as a result of them seeing the text in a timely manner.

initial_reviews.review_title: Amazing Texting App, Amazing Customer Service
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
There are many things I like about Textedly; but the main feature that stands out to me is that customer service is always there ready to help you out. The chat feature is awesome, and everytime we have had an issues, someone is there to help within 30 minutes or less. They are detailed in responses, and willing to help you as best as they can. The last representative we talked to, Paige, was super friendly and made everything so simple to fix. She replied quickly, and was very knowledgable about how to help us.

I also like the features they offer, especially the Tags we can create to keep our clients organized. They offer a lot of other features I think are interesting, but have not tried yet.

Textedly is also very easy to use, and has taken my co-workers very little time to understand. I use Textedly daily at work, and have been for over a year- it has everything we need at this time.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I can't say that I have much I dislike about Textedly.

Maybe the only thing I could think of was that you do have to pay to add more teammates, but I do not handle the payments here. I can just see that adding up when people have a lot of necessary people.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had found that a lot of potential clients did not want to call in or use a live-chat service, but instead wanted us to text them. We had not offered this previously, but since we started using Textedly, the amount of people wanting to speak to us via text has been large. I think being able to spreak through text message as a business is important for many reasons in this day and age.

The customer support is great.  They are responsive, solution oriented, and do not make issues seem like they are a bother to them.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
No mobile interface.  For a text service, the fact that there is no app version seems like a miss.  My job has me on my feet all the time and if I cannot get to a computer to send out a mass message in case of an emergency, I will have an issue.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I love how easy it is to use the platform. It's very intuitive, and even though I'd never set up a text-first platform before, it was easy to figure out. (It was similar in a lot of ways to setting up an email marketing campaign in HubSpot or Outreach.io) And when I had a question, their customer support team was extremely helpful.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish you had a native integration with Salesforce. Right now, I'm adding prospects to email and calling campaigns to Apollo, which syncs directly with Salesforce. But I don't want to use Zapier right now, so I'm just manually adding leads to select campaigns in Textedly. It's fine, but a bit inconvenient.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have more leads than we can manage manually, and our ICP prefers text communication 99% of the time. I can't use Apollo or Outreach to reach them. So once I have a call with a prospect who's interested, I can just add them to a text drip campaign to keep tabs on them for when they're ready to meet.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great platform for sending mass text messages
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I like that it is easy to add multiple users to your account and that there is an option for dividing customers out into different sections so you are not bombarding your customers with irrelevant messages. Customer service has gotten a lot better in the last few years and generally have the answer and are responsive and friendly. They have added lots of new features that weren't there before like adding emojis, scheduling messages and asking for reviews and payments via text messages. All of those features make business a lot easier in modern times as people are more interested in being able to reply to a text on their time schedule versus answer my call.

The first upload of all of your contacts can be a little bit tricky for those that aren't familiar with exporting data but after that, it is easy. It is very easy to learn how to use the features in the platform after your first few messages. It is nice to be able to use it to send a large amount of messages or just one individually and you can set it to email you when customers reply to your texts vs having to check your account all day.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish that there was a mobile app with it and didn't have to be used exclusively with a PC.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I don't have to call 500 customers anymore. I can just send them one text and be done with it

all_reviews.review_title: Very quick responses to my beginner questions...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I would happily reccomend Textedly for mass texting solutions. I switched to textedly from another texting app largely due to a lack of customer service and I have been very pleased with Textedly's quick and thorough responses to my questions. I received a call from a Danni M. within just a few minutes of signing up for the service and she assisted me in getting my account setup. That was super helpful. Also a live chat person named Paige has been very helpful, in both answering my questions and getting support tickets created for a few minor problems I had (due to my own errors). I have only been a customer for little more than a week but so far I have nothing bad to say about this service.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
No complaints so far. It is a little bit more expensive than my last texting service but overall I think the cost is not too bad. Ease of use and helpful/ prompt customer service has made it very worthwhile.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I run a fundraiser for a non-profit that needs an easy way to stay in touch with my customer base, textedly allows me to easily organize my text mailer list and communicate efficiently with those customers.

all_reviews.review_title: If youre anythng like me, selecting the right service for wht you need is a time consuming challenge
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I have a high degree of appreciation for the support team, live chat features, and personal phone calls i had with representatives. All of whom thoroughly assisted me in process of getting this service set up.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Its not textedlys fault, but these federal regulations on communications, such as this service, are overreaching and unwelcomed. As a small business owner who is intending to use this service to keep in touch with our (personal partners) 200-400 1099 contractors, these regulations are costly, confusing, and hold me accoutnable to the same standards you might see from a 50,000 person marketing campaign. Textedly support team has done a phenominal job walking us through this setup process.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am only one person and due to the nature of my business and industry, i have to keep up with 500 different people on a semi-monthly basis. This service will help me keep in touch with the individuals that fall through the cracks when trying to keep up with that many people manually.

all_reviews.review_title: Could be better, could be worse.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The tech-support is top notch, and they are always quick to respond. Also, I love that you can design text messages that include images.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
My organization holds multiple events throughout the year, and I would like to be able to update phone numbers in bulk batches with new tags, so I can send messages to the appropriate groups. However, Textedly does not let you do that and Unless you are going to go one by one on each account, you must upload the individual again with a new tag. So, I have some numbers in there 4 or 5 times because they are a part of 4 or 5 groups.

A bulk update feature like Mailchimp has would be very helpful.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us notify our the clients we serve of upcoming events, cancellations, and other important information. It is quick and allows us to notify large groups of people at once.

all_reviews.review_title: Texting is better for churches than email
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I love texting for churches. Ease of use, high response rates, and ability to drive behaviors is all excellent for texting vs other avenues of communication.

But why textedly?

Easy to get started & implement -
Customer support - a few minutes ago, I messaged customer support, and had a response in just a few minutes.
Speed and frequency of use - I can communicate with our entire congregation in seconds.
Excellent integrations - with various CRM options. They've been very growth oriented for the last several years that we've been with them.

Textedly has helped us grow our engagement with our congregation by promoting events, creating discipleship opportunities, and more.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Honestly, there's not much that I don't like.

Some of the features that are 1-time fees I wish were native, but that's about it.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I want to be able to quickly communicate in a venue that people receive and actually READ... then drive key behaviors and interactions. Textedly helps me do that.

Interface is user friendly. I can create messages quickly and send them conveniently. I can always depend on my messages being received when I want them to be received.

I use textedly as a way to send notifications and reminders to employees. When employees are terminated, I unsubscribe them. When we re-hire them, I have to make them go through the re-subscribe process. This is very time consuming and some of the re-hires don't understand how it works. Many employees slip through the cracks because of this system. Unsubscribed contacts cannot be deleted, which clutters up my contacts list. We have employees coming and going constantly.

Employees don't read emails often, but they do respond to texts. We can send out company reminders and notifications and know that they will see them because they come through a text. We are getting better participation with different programs as a result of them seeing the text in a timely manner.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing Texting App, Amazing Customer Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
There are many things I like about Textedly; but the main feature that stands out to me is that customer service is always there ready to help you out. The chat feature is awesome, and everytime we have had an issues, someone is there to help within 30 minutes or less. They are detailed in responses, and willing to help you as best as they can. The last representative we talked to, Paige, was super friendly and made everything so simple to fix. She replied quickly, and was very knowledgable about how to help us.

I also like the features they offer, especially the Tags we can create to keep our clients organized. They offer a lot of other features I think are interesting, but have not tried yet.

Textedly is also very easy to use, and has taken my co-workers very little time to understand. I use Textedly daily at work, and have been for over a year- it has everything we need at this time.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I can't say that I have much I dislike about Textedly.

Maybe the only thing I could think of was that you do have to pay to add more teammates, but I do not handle the payments here. I can just see that adding up when people have a lot of necessary people.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had found that a lot of potential clients did not want to call in or use a live-chat service, but instead wanted us to text them. We had not offered this previously, but since we started using Textedly, the amount of people wanting to speak to us via text has been large. I think being able to spreak through text message as a business is important for many reasons in this day and age.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Textedly?
review_question_answers.answer:
There are many things I like about Textedly; but the main feature that stands out to me is that customer service is always there ready to help you out. The chat feature is awesome, and everytime we have had an issues, someone is there to help within 30 minutes or less. They are detailed in responses, and willing to help you as best as they can. The last representative we talked to, Paige, was super friendly and made everything so simple to fix. She replied quickly, and was very knowledgable about how to help us.

I also like the features they offer, especially the Tags we can create to keep our clients organized. They offer a lot of other features I think are interesting, but have not tried yet.

Textedly is also very easy to use, and has taken my co-workers very little time to understand. I use Textedly daily at work, and have been for over a year- it has everything we need at this time.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Textedly?
review_question_answers.answer:
I can't say that I have much I dislike about Textedly.

Maybe the only thing I could think of was that you do have to pay to add more teammates, but I do not handle the payments here. I can just see that adding up when people have a lot of necessary people.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We had found that a lot of potential clients did not want to call in or use a live-chat service, but instead wanted us to text them. We had not offered this previously, but since we started using Textedly, the amount of people wanting to speak to us via text has been large. I think being able to spreak through text message as a business is important for many reasons in this day and age.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The customer support is great.  They are responsive, solution oriented, and do not make issues seem like they are a bother to them.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
No mobile interface.  For a text service, the fact that there is no app version seems like a miss.  My job has me on my feet all the time and if I cannot get to a computer to send out a mass message in case of an emergency, I will have an issue.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly is allowing me to reach all of the front line employees at a moment's notice.  I do not have a way of contacting everybody individually, however textedly makes it so I can reach a wide community in an easy manner.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I love how easy it is to use the platform. It's very intuitive, and even though I'd never set up a text-first platform before, it was easy to figure out. (It was similar in a lot of ways to setting up an email marketing campaign in HubSpot or Outreach.io) And when I had a question, their customer support team was extremely helpful.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish you had a native integration with Salesforce. Right now, I'm adding prospects to email and calling campaigns to Apollo, which syncs directly with Salesforce. But I don't want to use Zapier right now, so I'm just manually adding leads to select campaigns in Textedly. It's fine, but a bit inconvenient.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have more leads than we can manage manually, and our ICP prefers text communication 99% of the time. I can't use Apollo or Outreach to reach them. So once I have a call with a prospect who's interested, I can just add them to a text drip campaign to keep tabs on them for when they're ready to meet.

all_reviews.review_title: Our company was looking for a better way to reach our customers & textedly provided just that!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The easy to use interface, the ability to let customers sign themselves up and not tie up an employee with needing to assist them, & the fast customer service responses.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Not having the ability to re-subscribe a user.  Many of our customers are eldery and it has been difficult at times walking them through un-subscribing to a particular keyword and then subcribing to the correct one.  It would simplify the process if we could do it on our end.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is allowing our company to instantly notify customers of service issues & any other pertinent information we feel they should know.  Our customers have complained for a while about the inconsistency of alerting them to service issues over social media.  We decided to give Textedly a try and it has worked out great!

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform for sending mass text messages
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I like that it is easy to add multiple users to your account and that there is an option for dividing customers out into different sections so you are not bombarding your customers with irrelevant messages. Customer service has gotten a lot better in the last few years and generally have the answer and are responsive and friendly. They have added lots of new features that weren't there before like adding emojis, scheduling messages and asking for reviews and payments via text messages. All of those features make business a lot easier in modern times as people are more interested in being able to reply to a text on their time schedule versus answer my call.

The first upload of all of your contacts can be a little bit tricky for those that aren't familiar with exporting data but after that, it is easy. It is very easy to learn how to use the features in the platform after your first few messages. It is nice to be able to use it to send a large amount of messages or just one individually and you can set it to email you when customers reply to your texts vs having to check your account all day.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish that there was a mobile app with it and didn't have to be used exclusively with a PC.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I don't have to call 500 customers anymore. I can just send them one text and be done with it

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I'm sorry, but I honestly don't find anything super great about textedly aside from the fact that I'm stuck with them now because I can't just transport my list elsewhere given current regulations.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I find the platform difficult to use.  You can't change "groups" or update your lists without deleting them, which would require the customers to re-opp-in.  You should be able to swap around your groups so that you can maximize the daily allowance (ie- you had 3000 in a group. 100 over time opt out.  There's no way to easily add another 100 from another group to be able to use your daily allowance).

Also, I've tried to go through the most recent 'verification' process to use our local number instead of the toll free number 3 times and get all the way to the end after 20 mins and it doesn't submit (all 3 times) and just goes to a Textedly screen with their facebook logo...  Overall, I don't find any of the interface very user friendly.  I didn't love the 'old' interface that was switched from several months ago, but the new one is definitely not an upgrade.  You can't even just click "send preview text" anymore!  A downgrade in my opinion.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to reach our customer base by text.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Textedly?

People seem to check their texts more frequently than their email so that was key for us to use the product,  I liked that we could make a template with our company logo on the message.  With a picture/logo it made each message count as 3 messages instead of one.  I also liked the variety of packages that were available and we could put our service on pause for a few months when we don't need the service.  We are a baseball league and we are in our off season so we didn't need it until later.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Textedly?
review_question_answers.answer: I had a little trouble getting timely support over the weekend.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Timely communications

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Ease of use. Easy to load new users and tag them for different targeted groups. Easy to create templates for messaging. Easy to attach flyers into a message when a visual message is easier than words. Our clients rely on it for message reminders.  Under changing conditions, it is easy to send a quick message to large groups.  ABSOLUTELY INVALUABLE when Covid happened!  The support has been very helpful and personal.  Although the chat bot can provide some answers, I have always gotten a personal response from support, and they usually walk thru any questions with me.  Flexibility to adapt to the way we work, and we use it daily.  Very easy to train a new user.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Watching text length, because consumption of text units is based on text length.  However, when we exceed our usage, I think the incremental cost is more than reasonable considering it's value to our services.  We are a nonprofit so we are cost-conscious, although we have found it be a very reasonable and affordable communication tool form us.

Wish we could communicate in other languages that don't use regular alphabet.  As our clients have become more diverse, it would be helpful to translate in to Asian characters.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows us to reach groups of clients who need regular notices about service times and locations.  We provide over 50 mobile food pantries in 3 counties serving thousands of low income and homeless individuals and families.  They are dependent on knowing when and where food and other resources are available.  It enables us to reach them directly and communicate  changes as needed.  When COVID shut everything down, it gave us the flexibility to change how we served and we actually expanded to serve many more people during that time, and safely.

all_reviews.review_title: Textedly has positively boosted our business within a week!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I love the chat because the people on the other sides respond so quickly and walk you through your questions very thoroughly. I have used it multiple times and have been happy with it every single time. It has been very easy to use and you can send out 1,000s of texts within minutes! Overall I am really happy with Textedly.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
For our business specifically we want to send 1 time texts out to people so the keyword is a little bit limiting. I would like to be able to batch them however I would like and not have to link them to a keyword.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It solves the problem of sending out batch texts by the 1000s. It has increased our leads and we have seen a return on our investment.

all_reviews.review_title: Helpful service for the right purpose
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Our needs are extremely minimal and most of the solutions out there are cumbersome to manage and use. Our simple use-case (ability to mass communicate to employees in case of threats, severe weather, etc.) isn't worth the added cost and complexity of other system.  Textedly fits our needs well.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I understand why this is the case, but I believe all SaaS companies need to fix this: integration wiht SSO/SCIM services for all account types. Like so many others, the Textedly solution requires a more expense "enterprise" type of license for this to work.  As a result, to remove employees who have left the company from our Textedly service, we have to manually perform those changes.  We are working to build automations using BetterCloud or other tools but most SaaS companies require the enterprise versions for that as well.  So I guess I'm saying that SSO/SCIM has become a common business tool for all sizes of businesses, not just huge multi-million/billion dollare enterprises who have deep pockets.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Because we are a crisis hotline, we sometimes receive threats from abusers and we need to notify employees to avoid the office while we work with police to investigate.  We also use it to inform employees about severe weather and remind them of our policies and procedures to follow.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Textedly excels in its user-friendly interface and robust feature set. The platform makes it incredibly easy to set up and manage SMS marketing campaigns, even for those without technical expertise. Additionally, the customer support team is responsive and helpful, ensuring any issues are quickly resolved.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
While Textedly offers a comprehensive suite of features, its pricing can be a bit steep for small businesses or startups operating on a tight budget. The cost per message can add up quickly, especially for larger campaigns. Additionally, although the platform is generally intuitive, there is a bit of a learning curve when first navigating the more advanced features. A more extensive library of tutorials and guides would be beneficial to help new users get up to speed more quickly.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Participants' participation reminders

all_reviews.review_title: Overall a good product, but customer service leaves something to be desired
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The best part of textedly is having the ability to communicate with a lot of people in an instant. The user experience makes figuring out where everything is and how to use it all very simple and easy to use.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I have found the downsides to be the inability to send what I'd like to send with regard to emoji's and other additional text, the inability to remove some of the automatic text that goes out, and there not being any easy way to transfer a lot of numbers into the system. I would also say I haven't had the best experience with customer service teams online as the answers have often left me wanting and uptimately me having to figure it out on my own.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly gives me a way to get information in the hands of my community easily. I am constantly needing to give people more information and let them know about what we have coming up for them and this gives me a way to do that that is easier and more effective than email.

Easy interface. Very easy to use. Textedly team usually answers very promptly. I've never had an issue with the texts being deliverd.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
There have been several changes made over the past few years that have not been communicated to customers. Price increases, short codes being changed so customers are opting in to the wrong number, short codes being phased out "overnight" taking days to recover with the verification of a toll-free number... they always give free text messages when something like this happens, but I fear it's just a tactic to placate because it continues to happen.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly allows me to mass text very easily. There is no other way to do it effectively. They are making my life easier to communicate with clients.

all_reviews.review_title: The platform is not user-friendly to say the least. It seems to be a complicated system.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I'm sorry to say but I cannot find a unique feature about Textedly that makes me "like" anything about it. The priority option is the best thing that I can think of.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
There are so many steps when trying to do something that should be simple and time efficient.  We came from Zipwhip and it would have served Textedly well to design the program after their model.  I really wish there was a way to forward a text to another contact.  Having to cut and paste is simply not practical.

Another thing is, when making scheduled messages to our clients, this creates a new window for the contact's messages to appear once they answer the specific message. This is not effecient, as we have on going conversations with our contacts and it usually leads to having to look around for certain messages, due to a new window appearing from creating new messages.

We do not receive a notification of any sort (sound or visual) to notify us that a message has been receieved. This is another quality of Zipwhip that made a big difference when trying to get back to our clients.

The option of only having keywords to input a contact in our sytem also seems very irrelevant to us. The problem being, not everyone will fit into these keywords. But we have to choose one anyway in order to successfully save a contact. The use of the keywords help sometimes, but not really.

When wanting to message someone, the message tab and the inbox tab brings confusion. It seems if we are not already in conversation with a contact, we cannot search for their names in the inbox (which seems logical). But the steps to create a message to contact someone, seems too tedious and irrelevant. Referring back to Zipwhip, the simple access in typing a name into their message system worked with more ease.

There is no access to an app. That is the biggest downfall as it would be easier to see texts and alerts if we had access to an app.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Really, the only thing it's doing is keeping our clients in contact with us.

What do you like best about Textedly?

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I have had a few issues with the drip campaign feature. It was firing off duplicate messages to my users, who were rightly frustated. I wish there was a database with banned words, or better yet when you type your messages they would be underlined so I know in real time whether or not the message will send correctly. I also wish more mediums were supported. I've often wanted to send out a pdf to users, but can't.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly makes SMS marketing easy. The simple interface allows any administrator to jump in, learn it quickly, and be able to schedule multiple messages to several different audiences.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Textedly?
review_question_answers.answer: The UI is simple and allows me to easily send messages to users. The support also gets back to you in a timely manner and they're able to solve your problems. I use Textedly every day and it's a simple system to learn.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Textedly?
review_question_answers.answer: I have had a few issues with the drip campaign feature. It was firing off duplicate messages to my users, who were rightly frustated. I wish there was a database with banned words, or better yet when you type your messages they would be underlined so I know in real time whether or not the message will send correctly. I also wish more mediums were supported. I've often wanted to send out a pdf to users, but can't.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Textedly makes SMS marketing easy. The simple interface allows any administrator to jump in, learn it quickly, and be able to schedule multiple messages to several different audiences.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform, but doesn't fit our business model properly.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
It's easy to use, and customer service is usually very quick.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
We use the platform unconventionally, and it does not support our business model. The platform claims that "duplicates" are not uploaded, however we have so much wasted users because they've been uploaded 15+ times.  This eats up our keywords and causes us to overspend. I would like to see the keywords be optional upon uploading users. Most other texting and email platforms allow this, but Textedly does not.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Helps us reach our independent contractors quickly and efficiently, allowing us to avoid having to email.

In addition, any time I needed help I could reach out to Paige again which was great because it meant familiarity with our entire process and not have to reexplain ourselves to a new support agent. So far the process has been smooth! And the retrention rate on our clients has also been great, with an expected percentage of unsubscribes.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Better warnings to help dummy proof it. Such as forewarning not to send a campaign when your Textedly phone number hasn't been verified and approved yet.

Being able to contact our customers with brief, important update or offers is very beneficial.

all_reviews.review_title: Performing Arts Studio sending report cards/registering for classes
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
It was very easy to understand! It didn't take me long at all to figure out the platform. We needed to add a graphic of a report card so being able to do that was very nice. Every time I needed help customer support responded almost immediately which was incredible and helped me use the product as fully as I could.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The auto response system wasn't what I hoped (or maybe I didn't understand it fully!) I wanted them to be able to follow a chain of commands, like reply yes --> sends another message reply no --> sends another auto message. My goal was to have a bunch of texts automatically responded to, resulting in a list of classes the family wanted to register for. I was able to set up one auto response, but then to take them any further I had to have full blown text conversations and there was over 50 participants each week. So that didn't work out.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
It was supposed to help me automate info receiving, but like I said I never fully figured out how to see the automated process all the way through.

all_reviews.review_title: Dees the job with some limitations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
We can send out mass communications to our Team Members and it was easy to implement. You can now send attach files and pictures.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
There is no customer service available by phone, you have to message someone in a chat but they are usually fairly quick to respond. Unused messages no longer roll over to the next month. There is sometimes a delay in delivery of messages, and you can't confirm who did and did not receive messages. The dashbaord always says messages were delivered but some phone carriers will block certain messages.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
The need to communicate with all of our employees, especially those without a company email address.

all_reviews.review_title: Textedly's chat box support team is the saving grace of the service.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The chat box functionality allows me to ask questions, get help with registrations, renew membership and confirm delivery of texts.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Campaigns will always show a 100% delivery rate, even if the message never delivers.
It also doesnt make clear what is and isn't allowed in a text campaign. Examples: Link usage, shortened links, abbreviated phrases. I understand these are federal regulations, but I feel textedly has room to improve its guidance around that.

Would be great to receive warnings before sending a massive number of messages that end up not delivering. I usually have to investigate and get support from Textedly Chat box.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching customers in a noisy market.

all_reviews.review_title: Exactly what I was looking for!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I find Textedly to be extremely helpful, in the way that it is organized/set-up, and it's ease of use.  This service is exactly what I'm looking for, to reach my wide audience, simultaneously!  I also love that my contacts can respond to the text!

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish SMS services were able to easily use a shortened URL feature -- however, I found that I was able to make the accomodations on my end, to be able to include a URL in my mass text.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Textedly, I am able to reach my audience with one text message per month, to inform and update them on my events and business. Textedly has significantly reduced my workload in reaching out to every person I know.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Textedly is a smooth, easy-to-navigate, and full texting service. I have utilized Textedly for several years and have been delighted with the service. I have used to send messages to small groups of individuals as well as to a large groups of individuals. Using daily messages that I may preschedule has been a great tool. Yet, at the same time, being able to create templates for simple reminders to complex questions is another excellent tool found within Textedly.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
There are a lot of tools and resources available, and while I know many of them would be helpful, having time to review them all is a challenge. Otherwise, this tool is excellent, and I highly recommend it.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main challenge is keeping communication flowing to my audience. Textedly service has solved this by sending directly to the user community. The need for timely communication as well as general communication is critical and this tool provides a solution to both.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
I was searching for a texting service where I could simply input phone numbers and was so happy when I found Textedly! We took over a business that was still all on paper. To notify all the previous clients, we chose to text the phone numbers. It was easy to import all the phone numbers into Textedly and I was thrilled that Textedly automatically removed landlines and repeat numbers (removed ~400 numbers in our case). Very easy to create and send a message!

It does create a toll-free number for you, and replies go to your Textedly account instead of your personal/business number. I wish it had gone straight to my business phone in my case, but I simply put our business number in the message I sent out. Highly recommend, Textedly saved me hours and hours of time!

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I liked the entire service, it was very easy to use and even customer support was quick and helpful.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I took over a business that, in 2022, was still entirely paper-based and not electronic or digital at all. After copying all the hand-written phone numbers into a spreadsheet, I copy-pasted that list into Textedly's formatted spreadsheet and importing it into Textedly was intuitive and simple. Instead of having to text hundreds of phone numbers, I was able to send one mass message easily. Textedly also automatically removed repeat numbers and land lines.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and cost friendly service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
What is most helpful about textedly is the ease of use when sending out mass texts to our users/clients.  We are able to group them by keywords not by group.  So when sending a mass text to people we can easily find the group we want to send the texts to.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The only drawback to using textedly is not being able to modify the phone number of the person who subscribed.  In our organization, we frequently have to update and change phone numbers for our end users.  Being able to change those phone numbers to reflect a new phone number is not the best.

all_reviews.review_title: Textedly is so easy to use!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Everything is put together well to make it easier to text your employees.  It's all step-by-step.  And I like that there is no guessing.  Then we can check to see if folks GOT the text.  The follow-through is crucial to me.  It lets me know that the message is received and we can at least know they were reminded even if they fail to show up for their training.  Our employees depend on getting their texts for company information and training events.  I really didn't think they would!  So it's a big win for us all the way around.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
When employees leave our company, we cannot delete them from the database.  If they come back, we can't re-activate them.  They have to join on their own and that is just not a priority for them until they miss something important.    I'd like to be able to delete their information when they quit, then re-enter it when they return to work.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
If you are considering a great company for texting your employees, you really should consider Textedly.  The price is right, the customer service is spot on and I think you'll come to depend on it like we do.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We keep our employees informed about their training dates, weather information, and company activities.  It really keeps them engaged!  They have come to depend on receiving their texts that remind them about their training dates.  And they like being reminded of company events because between work and home,they are so busy, that these things tend to slip their minds.

In the transportation industry, truckers would rather text than talk on the phone, so this has really been a game changer for us.

There really isn't anything I don't like yet.  The only thing I hope that add is when I pull up my applicants by a key word, I either have to send a text out to all of them or individually. I would like to pull up all applicants by a certain key word, and then have the option of checking off the ones I want the text to go to and then just send the one text blast.

I am able to reach out to applicants  with new jobs that are posted in their hiring area on a weekly basis. I also did a text blast to all applicants that have applied with us this year and let them know we are hiring and asking them to come back. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
What I like about Textedly is that they make it simple to set up and get started.  No contracts to sign, and they are constantly throwing offers at you to get complimentary messages.  Along with that, it syncs to your email, so you get notified through your browser and your email.  They also allow you to build unlimited tags to categorize each of the subscribers you enter.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The only drawback to  Textedly is that you have to add subscribers to text them. You cannot simply type in a phone number and send a message.  They do make it easy to delete the subscriber, though.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem that Textedly has solved is that it allows me to reach candidates on every medium; call, email, and text.  We've realized the benefit of a shortened time to hire due to a quicker response rate by candidates.  It has also allowed us to stay in touch with candidates more regularly.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
We use Textedly for our non-profit to communicate with volunteers and those who want to hear more about our story.  We also use it for event promotion.  So far, I like Textedly and it has boosted our event attendance and facilitated quick communication with people interested in what we do.  We have segmented lists for banquet attendees, volunteers, etc. and that is a timesaving feature.  Overall the price is good for the service we receive and it has been easy to get support when needed.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The interface is not as visual as I prefer.  Adding people to texts can be a bit clunky, but it works.  I'd like to see Textdly possibly do a drag-and-drop solution or something a little simpler.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly allows me to communicate directly with our volunteers and donor base, receive messages and reply back personally.  This has made our communication more efficient.

I'm sorry but tanning lotion is not illegal drugs or contraband freaking idiots. It's impossible to get anyone on the phone.

None now. They are actually causing problems. As after they revoked my account, I cannot even get in my account to export all of my contacts in there to a different site so they have completely revoked my account. I've lost all of my information, all of my contacts and all of my $25,000 messages that I have paid for and saved up. Not to mention have not been able to take to anyone and my account was restricted

all_reviews.review_title: Textedly is the Perfect Solution for Small Businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
As a very small business, I love that Textedly is reasonably priced and can grow with me. Many of the other services have a base rate that is two to four times higher. I've used Textedly daily for four years and I would never switch at this point.

It is very easy to get set up, and easy to use. I've started doing some white-listed work for a client; we were up and running to 500 subscribed in a day. They love the service, and just expanded it to more of their staff. They are a nonprofit with seven nursing homes and a variety of social services. They have been badly impacted by the strain of the pandemic. You wouldn't think a daily text would make a difference but it does!

I am a semi-professional photographer, so I love the ability to use images, which I do every day. This really resonates with my subscribers and my white-listed client.

Customer service is great. Reliability is great. They keep adding in reports and APIs. Just a great service.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The only thing that is missing for me is a true mobile app. Yes, I can log in on my phone. But a true mobile app would be amazing.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
If you are looking for a high-quality, cost-effective SMS service, sign up with Textedly today! I recently did a market analysis when taking on a large client. Textedly is still head and shoulders above the rest!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am  a coach and energy healer. The problem I solve is that people, especially during the pandemic, are struggling to manage stress, self-care, hope, depression, grief, loss. In the best of times, people have mindsets and habits that get in the way of satisfaction, happiness, and joy. Many people can't afford or don't want to work with a coach. Additionally, training programs create a "wow" factor that gets lost a week or two later.

I use Textedly to send daily positivity messages. This isn't puppies and bunnies. It's very short messages that address a wide variety of things that get in the way of resilient happiness. The messages are paired with carefully curated photos that work in tandem to create a thought-provoking "word of wisdom." So, it's a daily reminder to look (quickly) inward and keep an eye on where you cause your own unhappiness.

My four year retention rate is about 95%. I have my first corporate client with white-listed and they are thrilled; their retention rate so far is 94%.

My personal subscribers are now asking for calendars and a book of my Sunday "Happiness Sermons in 100 Words."

Additionally, I use the "message me" feature. Especially with the pandemic, I am seeing an increase in "micro-coaching" through the messages. It sounds ridiculous but I have had some very moving text exchanges with my subscribers.

all_reviews.review_content:

Good at first. The price was competative.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Failure to respond. 2 weeks of near-daily inquiries to their Chat, Email and live phone number. All of my queries are ignored. All communication from my end has been professional and respectful. I am simply trying to gather info on what we could salvage due to 'Carrier dropped'. We were dropped due to this being considered a gambling site. We had been posting BINGO messages with Textedly for almost 3 years with no issues, then a sudden and full cancellation of service, to include our non-BINGO related keywords. No warning, and especially no ability to discover what we did wrong or how to salvage. Our American Legion post messages now offline, and we are now scrambling to recover. Complete unprofessional handling of this situation by the Textedly staff.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Posting of post closures due to weather events. Reminders of meetings. Notification of monthly newsletter availability and BINGO.

all_reviews.review_title: Textedly didn't just meet, but exceeded my expectations!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The feature set is robust and can meet a wide range of needs. We used Textedly to manage messaging and announcements to 500 attendees at a conference we put on. My favorite part of my Textedly experience was definitely the customer service. Setup was so easy! I got connected with a rep on their team who made it incredibly easy to get everything setup and verified.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I really don't have many dislikes. My only disclaimer here is that we used this tool in a limited use case only during the duration of our event there may be other nuances for use in other applications that one could find frustrating. But in our use case, I didn't run into any issues.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
This is a great platform option, at the very least I highly suggest checking it out to see if it suits your needs!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
As I mentioned we used this for communication with a large group of attendees at a conference. The benefits were numerous - we were able to schedule all our main communications and add any on the fly as needed. Using textedly over a full-blown conference app as we have in the past saved us a TON of money and produced the same if not better result.

all_reviews.review_content:

We love the ability to tag subscribers to segment them and the amazing value of the service!

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The mobile view is difficult to figure out how to see incoming messages.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
Great option if you need cheap and segmented texts. Hard to handle incoming texts, especially when on a mobile device. Also, you cannot edit someone's keyword if you subscribe them to the wrong one.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
We love that we can tailor our messages to our different segments of delivery drivers with ease. We need the ability to segment drivers and let them know when a new order comes in that fits within their specific vehicle size. Textedly is an easy-to-use and very cost-efficient method to get our messages out!

The ease of use of the platform. Not had to add images.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
The delay in messages going out. The fact that one image text uses 3 credits is costly.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
Get a plan with enough credits for your mailing list. If you plan to use images in text, multiply your list x3 and that's how many credits you will need per message sent. If you send texts 4 x a month then multiply that number by 4 and that's how many credits you'll need to pay for monthly.

all_reviews.review_title: Reliable service with intuitive UI and unbeatable customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The Textedly developers make it intuitive to navigate the dashboard as a client. If I imagine where I'd need to find out how to do "x," it's probably there, and about as simple as I want it. It's easy to start a conversation with a text message, with recipients able to respond and responses coming to my dashboard. The rates are reasonable as well.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Texts don't roll over to the next month, which would be a nice addition if they did. It would also be better if, after a scheduled messages, numbers I added would automatically receive that text message instead of having to either manually send them a message or just have them not included in that campaign at all.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
Give it a try! It's a great product. Customer support is there for you if you need them.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving how to communicate with brevity with clients at a time and way that best suits them. Text messages rise above the noise of emails. I've realized how important it is to communicate at the right time, sending messages at a time when I know clients will likely be most open to looking at their phones.

all_reviews.review_title: The Only Text Messaging Service You Will Ever Need!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Textedly has been amazing in helping me grow my business and staying in touch with people without exhausting my personal phone number! With a ton of possibility and easy to use integration I truly feel this is why after trying out so many other text messaging products that Textedly was the one that truly stuck out! Textedly really goes to the top of the list in regards to everything we have tried because it is an easy to use web based app that allows the user to setup their account and hit the ground running as soon as they enter billing details! A key note is this: Textedly is very committed to it's users, offering incentive based rewards for giving honest feedback to them. I haven't found any other service that is that willing to do that for their customers on a regular basis.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I have to say that I haven't found a feature that warrants me disliking it, that being said this may be operator error but sometimes when in bound texts come in I don't see them right away because a certain message pops up! The only real dislike that I have is there is currently no app for textedly yet, or at least that I know of! If they are to come out with an application for IOS or Android I think they hands down beat anyone else on the market and you can then consider it game over from here on out!

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
It's the best decision you can make and honestly I haven't found one problem yet since using textedly. You would be crazy to not consider it as a go to source for your text messaging needs or to give it a try regardless! I would always say that you should go out and try other services as well as something like textedly. That is the only way that you are going to experience different points of view and learn what software is actually best for you! At the end of the day Textedly is only one service among many out there, but they check all the boxes and make it easy for the user to use and level up their business or just to keep their clients informed every step of the way! I don't know about you but in my business I always have parents of athletes that I train wanting to make sure they are communicated with on an hour by hour basis and it gets exhausting to constantly have 20+ email chains going on! Textedly is the one stop shop solution to take care of all of that! With anything in business or contemplating investing in a service you want to test, re-test, and re-test some more and find out exactly what is going to work for you! But given the price point, functionality, and user friendliness I don't see how you could possibly decide to go with anyone other than textedly! Here is the thing...what do you have to lose by trying them out over the competition and if you don't like it you can simply move on and try something else, it's as simple as that! Good luck with whatever service you choose, but when it comes to text messaging and SMS marketing I dont think you need any other option as your go to!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall communication with my clients whether its schedule updates or just general product information!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
The best part of Textedly is that its platform is so easy to use. Creating a message takes under 30 seconds, and it reaches a variety of audiences in your community. I also love that you can create organized groups to send messages that are relatable to that specific group. I appreciate that I can always rely on the Textedly support team to assist me with anything in a speedy fashion. Textedly has been a wonderful commnication platform.

It would be lovely to have a few more characters per message before expanding it into a second message. However, I have zero complaints about Textedly. It has been a highly effective communication tool for our business.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
If you want a simple and effective tool, pick Textedly!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textedly allows us to send reminders and updates to our community instantly, which is helpful when our registrations are about to close. We also use Textedly to send important texts regarding our facilities Covid procedures.

all_reviews.review_title: Very useful for our Non-profit Food Bank
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
This platform is super intuitive and helps us get information out to clients. We use it to send out a schedule of food deliveries to our clients, and they love it. It helps keep them updated for cancellations in inclement weather or holidays. I certainly like that you don't have to pay for what you don't need but you have options. I really like that I can schedule a post out to deliver at the beginning and midmonth, as well as having the option of a welcome text.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
So far, I don't have any complaints; it works perfectly. If I had a complaint, it would be that it has a piece-meal pricing system, but that's also pretty nice as it keeps the costs down as we aren't spending money on what we don't need. Though it is intuitive, I think some things could be more clarified upfront regarding how your assigned phone number works and how to add shortcodes.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
I think if you are looking for a quality text service, look no further. These are full ten digits numbers, not the more accessible five digit text numbers

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
As above, it helps us distribute information to clients on where to pick up food and gives us a direct line to inform them of changes or cancellations. We also use the platform to help share cooking and health tips to provide our clients with more value

For us, it makes it very easy to communicate new policies and reminders to our employees.  We have employees starting at 3 AM and ending at 9 PM and with COVID we didn't always want to meet face to face.  Textedly allowed us to send a message to all of them at the same time.

It also works with our members for certain programs, we recently moved and changed our P.O. Box and sending a message was a lot cheaper than sending a post card.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I accidentally deleted an employee from our subscriber list and I can't get him reactivated.   Seems like there should just be a quick button to click if it was done by me if he would've text stop then obviously I shouldn't be able to add him back.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
Textedly is an easy way to communicate with all staff and have documentation showing it.

It allows us to notify all employees at once of new policy changes.

What do you like best about Textedly?
The Customer Service department is very kind and takes time to learn about your needs to find the best package to assist you. They were courteous, thorough, and generous with my welcome package. The representative walked me through the site, helped me set up my text number, and walked me through sending a test message. The app is so easy to use and gives great analytics to see how often you text, who responds, and how engaging people are with links.

This isn't a dislike, but it would be nice to see top responders. Message responses are separated every time you send a new message, so it would be nice to see who responds more often.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
This is the texting app to start with if you need something easy, organized, and dummy proof!

My business is about getting inspirational messages out to people in a way that goes beyond social media. Textedly helped me to create short messages and go directly to the person and allows people to invite others easily.
People can respond, get pictures and videos, and I can improve my content based on how engaged people are.

I have tried many different texting services but Textedly was the most affordable and has all I was looking for. Customization, simple to use, and tracking my results. I highly recommend their service.

I had an issue with sending out my message to 20,000+ of my subscribers at once and when I reached out to Textedly's customer service, they quickly got their  IT department team involved and solved the issue quickly (within a day). all_reviews.review_title: Solid, straight forward and reliable service!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Fairly easy to add new customers and keywords, straight forward layout, text replies also go to email which is helpful, pricing is straightforward, and easy to increase character counts or add a picture.

What do you dislike about Textedly?
Only thing I've come across that is more of an annoyance than a problem is that when composing a text and needing to expand the number of characters, you can do so from 160 to 306, but if you discover 306 is not enough, you cannot easily expand to 455. The workaround is to copy the text already written, downgrade from 306 to 160 (which erases all characters after 160), and then upgrade to 455 and repaste the copied text. You can then continue composing the message.  I had to learn the hard way after a couple of times losing a good chunk of the message. I've asked the team to implement this feature to upgrade easily from 306 to 455.

Only other thing that is not the fault of Textedly, but rather bulk texts in general, is that I have had customers ignore it because the initial number of the text can look like spam.

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
Much faster to have today's phone-focused clients update billing information when receiving a text than an email.  Ability to send urgent reminders or notifications that are more likely to be viewed.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textedly?
Helps with connecting instantly with new employees. It's great to chat in real-time, and that people have to text more accessible on their phones. I like the application is easy to view on the attraction side of the application. When I sent a text to myself, at first, it came through clearly, and it didn't look odd/or as a scam. In addition, I LOVE that I can send a picture to people too! I think that people really can put an idea together when there is a picture along with the words, especially to those looking for new employment. I like that it was quick to add a new user to the account and that it was easy for them to get their account set up without me walking them through it or having to authorize a new user. Super easy!

What do you dislike about Textedly?
I wish I could send a message right after adding a new subscriber. I could get to the message board just after making a new user; it would eliminate three clicks in the system. In addition, it would be nice to have two users when setting up an account. It's a bummer that we would have to purchase a new 'seat.' I think it would be great to have a quick button to create a new message on the page instead of clicking onto the dashboard on the left side. I think most users would be able to send out more messages out faster and would save multiple clicks. I would add quick-click accessibility to the application instead of having to go back to my dashboard every time I want to add or submit a new message to someone. In addition, having a desktop application to download would be pretty great too! The notifications are great most of the time, but for some reason, I think that it has been great to automatically have two users on the account, especially in a business setting. Its common practice that there is a primary or authorized  use in addition to someone else on the team to help. You never know when something changes, and someone might need to get in and use the account.

Recommendations to others considering Textedly:
If you are looking for a desktop-friendly application, textdly is it! I have used others and this is super easy to use!

What problems is Textedly solving and how is that benefiting you?
I enjoy the instant response and the ability to purchase a local number. In addition to purchasing, other applications to be added on top of the text app. In the modern market, it's tough to get a hold of anyone in recruiting, because of the pandemic and over usage of scam calls. Texts help eliminate all of that by simply being able to message them. And being able to purchase an actual number made it that much better. Lastly, it helps brand awareness as well. I enjoy the keyword feature and being able to connect with those in a group setting. It's nice to send out alerts for new job positions or to keep in contact with those who hold interest within my groups. A significant benefit to having a desktop-accessible application is that we can link it to our email and notifications as the day goes along. It's been great to have the opportunity not to have a personal work cell phone, and it has helped our team out a lot. We are able to leave the work at home but still see the notifications come through when we have the chance to check. It helps separate the home and work-life balance.
